p: Despite the close genetic relationship, S. abrotanoides and S. yangii are suggested to be separate species. Moreover, intraspecies genetic variation within the S. yangii taxon, between “wild type” S. yangii and its cultivars (‘Lacey Blue’ and ‘Blue Spire’), was observed. Furthermore, the intermediate location of S. yangii ‘Blue Spire’ between the two Salvia species suggests that the ‘Blue Spire’ cultivar might have been created through hybridization between S. abrotanoides and S. yangii during the cultivation process.
